result.execSummary:
The defendant L T Austin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Same as probation conditions if revoked.

miscConds.notes:
Pay all of following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. All court costs, fees and surcharges including DNA.  Bail to apply.  
If revoked, to be paid through collection by DOC of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended Supervision.  DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
All applicable fees of supervision.

Provide a DNA sample.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm; also advised that he may not vote until his civil righs have been restored.

No alcohol or drugs.
No possession, consumption, selling, distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
Follow all rules of supervision. Follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.
AODA assessment.  Cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.  Absolute/maintain sobriety.  Random urine screens.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. L T Austin

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Signed and filed: Decision and order DENYING DOC petition to discharge probation. Copies to DOC and DA's office.
Per order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to Hon. Janet C. Protasiewicz, Br. 24, calendar successor, for review. mag
EARLY DISCHARGE RECOMMENDATION RECEIVED AND FORWARDED TO JUNE S. OS

Defendant L T Austin in court with attorney Allison Marie Ritter.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 3.5 YEARS with 30 days credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 1.5 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.

Court finds defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program but IS eligible for the WI Substance Abuse program.  

Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on 3 YEARS probation.  

Conditions of Probation/ Extended Supervision if revoked:
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
- Random urine screens.
- Obtain/maintain fulltime employment/education/vocation.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  Cash bail on deposit to be applied.
-  If revoked, the Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  

Filed:  
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence 
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Letters in Support of the Defendant received and filed.

Defendant L T Austin in court with attorney Allison Marie Ritter.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Pursuant to plea negotiations, Count 1 is dismissed but read in for the purpose of sentencing.  As to Count 2: Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  Case is adjourned for sentencing in Branch 22.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
For reasons stated on the record, the Court GRANTS defense motion for removal of GPS monitoring.  All other conditions of bail previously ordered remain.

Defendant L T Austin in court with attorney Allison Marie Ritter.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin for Randy Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court grants defendant's request for substitution of attorney Ritter for attorney Canfield.
Defense requests plea and sentencing date.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 6, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Request for substitution received and filed.
Motion for Bail Modification to Remove GPS received and filed.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant L T Austin in court with attorney Jason Canfield.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for plea hearing, however defense requests more time.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 25, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Third order Amending Conditions of Bail. Signed and filed.

Defendant L T Austin in court with attorney Jason Canfield.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Defendant on waiting list for DTC. Defense requests an adjourned Plea Hearing. Court granted defense request. Parties advised effective August 1, 2015, this case will be reassigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22, Room 608 of the Courthouse. Case adjourned to branch 22.  Plea hearing scheduled for August 4, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed, Justice Point Report.

Defendant L T Austin in court with attorney Jason Canfield.  Marissa Luz Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Case calendared for PLEA and SENTENCING on 6/15/2015 at 1:30 pm in Branch 15.
Justice Point Report received and filed. sab
Attorney Canfield called regarding Status conference on May 11, 2015 at 8:30.  Defense counsel would like case to be heard in the afternoon same date.   Deputy Court Clerk:  AA.
Second Order Amending Conditions of Bail filed.  Deputy Court Clerk:  AA.

Order Amending Conditions of Bail filed.  The defendant be allowed to go to the DMV to register his vehicle, to leave his home to further his search for employment, to go to his sister's house to help care for his mother up to five (5) days per week for up to two (2) hours per day.  Deputy Court Clerk:  AA.

Defendant L T Austin in court with attorney Jason Canfield.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  AA.  Court granted defense counsel's motion to amend the bail condition so that defendant can have extra release time with the already ordered electronic monitoring to care for his mother.  Court advised defense counsel he would have to submit paperwork to the Court.   Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 15.  Status conference scheduled for May 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  Deputy Court Clerk:  AA.

Defendant L T Austin in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk:  ss

Case was calendared for plea/sentencing this date.   Defense request for release from GPS monitoring is heard and denied. Defense motion to withdraw as counsel of record is heard and granted.  Court ordered case adjourned for status of counsel in Branch 15.  Status conference scheduled for 04-17-2015 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Report received and filed. sab

Defendant L T Austin in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Marissa Luz Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
  ENTRY MADE WITHOUT COURT FILE.
Bail motion by defense argued and granted by the Court.  Court amends GPS release to include laundry, grocery shopping, AODA treatment if enrilled, care for mother once per week for 2 hours and a one time release to obtain an ID.

15RM012421  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
03-06-15

Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont in court, defendant L T Austin not in court, in custody.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense motion for modification of bail heard and denied.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 9, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 15.

Defendant L T Austin in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant L T Austin in custody.  Lindsey Anderson, student intern under the supervision of Ron Dague for Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Stark.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Watts, Br. 15.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for March 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring and Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY  to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant L T Austin in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant L T Austin in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  Defense entered a plea of NOT GUILTY as to Count 1.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
